title: Wales star Josh Navidi ruled out of Rugby World Cup with hamstring injury
text:
Navidi left the field gutted to have suffered a hamstring injury (Picture: Getty)

Josh Navidi will play no further part in Wales’ Rugby World Cup campaign after suffering a hamstring injury during the victory over France.

Navidi was replaced by Ross Moriarty inside the first half-hour of Wales’ dramatic 20-19 victory and was immediately given ice and treatment on his left hamstring.

Moriarty soon joined him on the bench due to a yellow card but claimed a late try to win the game and will be an automatic replacement in the starting XV for fellow No 8 Navidi.

Navidi could only watch as his team-mates edged past France (Picture: Getty)

However, the loss of Navidi, 28, will be keenly felt by the Wales squad who are currently preparing for a semi-final clash with South Africa on Sunday.

Warren Gatland confirmed the injury in a press conference on Monday, revealing that Navidi had suffered a grade two hamstring tear.

While Moriarty is the obvious choice to replace the Cardiff Blue at the base of the scrum, Wales will also fly out a squad replacement for the last two weeks of the tournament.

But Navidi is understood to be remaining with the squad because he is a crucial character in the dressing room.

Wales also have injury concerns over Hadleigh Parkes and Jonathan Davies ahead of Sunday’s semi-final and Gatland is thought to be considering flying out extra cover in midfield rather than another back-row forward.
description: Josh Navidi will play no further part in Wales' Rugby World Cup campaign after suffering a hamstring injury during the victory over France.
